revised_title: Triglyceride Fatty Acid Removal in Rat Circulation
tldr: The authors studied the removal of triglyceride fatty acids from the circulation in the supradiaphragmatic portion of rats. They discovered that most of the injected labeled material was recovered in muscle and skin, and that endogenous triglycerides in d < 1*006 lipoproteins were removed from the plasma at a similar rate to injected chylomicra lipid. The findings contribute to current concepts of fatty acid transport.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Lipid Metabolism
